dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RYAN HANSEN, shirtless and lightly perspiring (never sweating), huffs and puffs his way up this iconic "hiking trail in the Hollywood hills, all the while talking direc into his iPhone's Periscope app.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What-what! We got straight up picked up, ya'll! Pilot-to-series, suckas! YouTube Red in da hiz-ouse! Brace yourselves for five -- count ‘em -- FIVE more eps of this bad boy right in your pie whole! Wah-DOOSH! ON SCREEN we see a running commentary from IGS Live watchers: Who are you? -- #WeirdAF -- Don't say hiz-ouse. RYAN (cont'd) YTR guys said there was a "less than normal" viewership loss from this crazy viral twerking grandma video that they linked us to. Less than normal! His words, not mine. Crushing iiiit! (beat) BT-dubs, I just want to thank my co- star, the honorable Detective Jessica Mathers -- she made me better in every scene. You know chemistry is a two way street. And some times there are stop lights and some times there are unprotected left hand turns -- but you just keep going. Because... traffic, right? (faux reflective) But I'm not gonna let this show go to my head. It's all about finding my center. Staying grounded. Staying mindful. That's why I'm out here reconnecting with nature. Ryan pans his camera to show a literal PARADE of SHIRTLES MEN and HALF-NAKED WOMEN with insane bodies all walking u Runyon, taking selfies and shooting videos as they "hike" RYAN (cont'd) It's so real up here away from the hustle and bustle of the "LA scene".  Behind Ryan, a VAMPY GIRL in crazy skimpy booty shorts, holds her phone down below her ass then brings it up to h face where she smiles and gives a peace sign while holdin package of "Flat Tummy Tea" she's hawking. RYAN (cont'd) Awesome tea. Totes works. At the top of Runyon, Ryan pans the hazy skyline, landing back on himself... RYAN (cont'd) Honestly though you guys, I don't know how the writers are gonna improve on the pilot. Such a barn burner. I mean, seriously -- how do you top opening on a dead body?

dialogues.speaker: TWO DEAD BODIES
dialogues.text: lying on the living room floor. We're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, sporting a very strange 18TH CENTURY ARMY OFFICER'S UNIFORM, kneels into frame.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Two dead bodies. Ryan pulls a pair of sunglasses from his coat, inexplicab putting them on for "dramatic effect". The crime scene has been taped off. A couple of BEAT COPS stand watching as a PHOTOGRAPHER snaps pictures and CORON prepare two gurneys.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you wearing? Ryan spins to see JESSICA MATHERS snapping on a pair of rubber gloves.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I've got an audition later.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Is it to be a talking hand-job? Because you're nailing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's for Hamilton, the musical?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Do they serve dinner during it? Mathers pushes past Ryan to take in the dead bodies on th floor.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Haw-haw. No -- it's for the movie version. They're doing like an action re-imagining of it without the songs -- I'm going in for Aaron Burr who's like the co-lead. He was played by a black guy in the original, but he was originally originally a white guy, so like, I'm kinda right for it? But not ina racist way or anything. More like returning to the source material or whatever.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Look at me. Look at my eyes. I literally do not give a fuck. Ryan laughs it off.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hilarious. Great delivery. Anyhow, I binge-watched that milk commercial like a million times to get inside his head as a character. Doing a deep dive on this one. Pete Berg is directing. I hear all the actors are gonna go through Navy Seal training for it. So cool, right? If I get it, it could like totally change my career. I'm just wearing this period plumage to fully immerse myself in the role. Streep says 80% of acting is wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, the other 20% is you. (beat) Now if you wouldn't mind shutting the fuck up so I can do my job.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Our job. For five more episodes. Guaranteed. Partner.  4. Ryan smiles smugly. Mathers sighs, but turns her attentio back to the bodies and we get our first good look at them late twenties, MAN and WOMAN, both dressed like they're going to a Renaissance Fair except, bizarrely, the man's wearing the dress and the woman's wearing the pants and puffy shirt (Seinfeld™). The man has a KNIFE, buried to the hilt, sticking out of chest and the woman's face is nearly purple, a small VIAL rests inches from her lifeless fingers. Mathers looks to the BEAT COP standing nearby...

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: You first on?

dialogues.speaker: BEAT COP
dialogues.text: Yeah. (to Ryan) Hey, Ry.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Frank. What's good?

dialogues.speaker: BEAT COP
dialogues.text: Same old. They laugh like old pals. Mathers is confused.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Who? Frank? Course I do. Everyone knows The Franken-ator. Frankenstein! Ryan and Frank do a fun fist bump thing. Mathers doesn't like it one bit.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT COP
dialogues.text: You still owe me twenty bucks, Hansen.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No way! You didn't eat the whole thing -- that was the bet! They yuck it up a bit. Clearly, Ryan's a people person an Mathers is deeply annoyed by that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- sorry to interrupt international grab-ass hour, but you two mind knocking it the fuck off? Total killjoy. Frank and Ryan straighten up.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT COP
dialogues.text: Sorry, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Run it for me.

dialogues.speaker: BEAT COP
dialogues.text: Happened last night. No sign of forced entry. Nothing missing from the house as far as we can tell. No witnesses. Neighbor found him this morning. Pretty thin.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: We got names?

dialogues.speaker: BEAT COP
dialogues.text: John Smith and Jane Dough.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: You haven't ID'd them yet?

dialogues.speaker: BEAT COP
dialogues.text: No, those are their real names.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: God I hate this town. (beat) This his place?

dialogues.speaker: BEAT COP
dialogues.text: Yeah. She lives off of Melrose.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Do we know what's in the vial?

dialogues.speaker: BEAT COP
dialogues.text: Not yet. Lab boys are running it now. Ryan nods, faking like he's giving this a lot of thought.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What's your read on this one?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Well...they're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Same. Same. (beat) What do you make of their outfits?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Maybe they found out they were auditioning for the same role as you and they killed themselves out of shame.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No chance. These aren't working actors. I'd know. Mathers shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Okay, Little Lord Fauntleroy, what you're looking at here is your garden variety murder-suicide, with a sprinkle of "Los Angeles normal" cross-dressing thrown in for funsies. Quick version: yada-yada motivation, she stabs him...

dialogues.speaker: A CSI-STYLE GRAINY FLASHBACK--
dialogues.text: we watch as Jane stabs John in the chest, then slugs back the vial, instantly frothing and clutching her throat.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...then tosses back whatever Hemlock- light is in that vial there to off herself. No forced entry, his blood literally on her hands. Adds up pretty clean.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: But that's what bothers me about it. It's too clean. Ryan nearly jumps out of his blouse-pants.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh dude! That was sick! Great line. Total trailer moment! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RYAN (cont'd) (mimicking her) "It's too clean." So good. Can I give you a note though? I think you could carve it out a little more if you add some space work to it. Check it. Ryan squats by the bodies, putting his sunglasses back on He rises, taking them off as he stares into the distance. RYAN (cont'd) That's what bothers me about it: it's too clean. (breaking) See? Better right? I think you should maybe consider adding a toothpick or a match to your mouth. Like something you're always chewing on? Could be your "thing", plus you know, mouth props.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: You're a mouth prop. (moving off) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Jane Dough's place to see if we can get some answers. Mathers exits. Ryan calls after her, following...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Ooh! Or a red coffee straw! Like you're trying to quit caffeine, but we never come out and say it -- it's like a mystery! Baller backstory!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mathers drives, Ryan rides shotgun. He tugs at his collar sweating.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Why don't you take that thing off. It's like 100 degrees out.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Art is suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially when you do it.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Make fun, but I'm gonna nail this audition tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Your audition is tonight?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: 9pm.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: They hold auditions that late?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: It's kind of an after-hours thing. The assistant associate casting director asked me to come in after they're closed. I guess she doesn't want me to intimidate the other actors. She's even keeping it off the books. Very hush hush.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: So...it's a secret audition?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Exactly. I'm pretty much like the Zero Dark Thirty of auditioning -- swoop in at night, kill Osama -- in this case Osama would be the audition, not like a real person -- and get out. (beat) So we better solve this case before 9pm tonight, or you're on your own. Cuz nothing is keeping me from landing this one. (into phone) Siri, set an alarm for 9pm tonight, the moment my life will change forever.

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: True change comes from within. Ryan scratches his neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously though, I think I might be like legit allergic to wool. Are these neck blisters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest duplex off of Melrose. Mathers and Ryan the front door.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So what do we know about this place?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: We know she lived here.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Ah. Good. Strong clue.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Just shut up and let me do the talking. Mathers knocks on the door. They wait.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hey -- you think I should have a badge?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Yes. Mathers knocks again, louder.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Because you're a moron and it would be illegal. But mostly the first part.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: How am I supposed to give an authentic performance if you guys won't let me have a gun or a badge? approach  10.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I guess you'll just have to rely on the suspension of disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Stay here. I'm gonna take a look around back.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What do I do if someone comes to the door?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Ask ‘em if they want to buy musket insurance.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (90% sure) Ha -- that's not a real thing. With that, Mathers moves off around back leaving Ryan sol on the doorstep. Unable to be alone with his thoughts for more than three seconds, Ryan pulls out his phone. He fucks around with some SnapChat face apps: waggy-tongu dog, squeaky-voiced deer, crying baby. Totally normal. Suddenly, out of the corner of his eye, Ryan spots moveme inside the apartment. He cups his hand to the front windo and sees

dialogues.speaker: A HOODIED KILLER
dialogues.text: clutching a knife, slinking through the empty apartment. Ryan's eyes go wide. RYAN (cont'd) Whaaaa? Suddenly, the bathroom door opens and out steps a stunnin SIX-FOOT BLONDE wrapped in a towel having just gotten out the shower. She puts in her ear buds and moves off, unwitting. The Killer closes in on her. Ryan whisper-screams for Mathers RYAN (cont'd) Mathers! Mathers!  11. Nothing. No answer. The clock is ticking. No time to lose, Ryan breaks into action! Ryan kicks the door and falls backwards eating shit into some ADJACENT SHRUBBERY. He pops up and throws his should into it. Once, twice, thrice -- BOOM -- the door opens an in rushes our hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hand-held behind the killer as he approaches the girl's back. She unwraps her towel. The Killer raises his knife... ...when suddenly RYAN DIVES AT HIM THROUGH A SIDE DOOR, yelling a warrior's cry...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Clooooooney! ...and tackling the would-be assailant to the ground --

dialogues.speaker: THUD
dialogues.text: The girl SCREAMS -- spinning to see Ryan standing on top the intruder, clutching the knife.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: What the fuck man!? Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I'm Ryan Hansen.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: The Nickelodeon Slime-Time nominated actor? I just totally saved your life.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: Saved my life? From who?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: From like the killer. Duh. On cue, the Killer groans...

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: Ow! I think you broke my arm, asshole!  12. Ryan looks down and spots the Killer who pulls off his authentic "SCREAM" mask a GoPro strapped to his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE
dialogues.text: That's my scene partner, douche. We're rehearsing! Just then, Mathers rushes in, gun drawn. BLONDE (cont'd) Whoa -- what the hell?! Mathers takes in the situation, putting it together quick Her shoulders slump. She sighs...

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Dingbat -- what the fuck did you do? Ryan looks down at the Killer...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: My bad, dawg.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN'S FACE ON SCREEN.
dialogues.text: we're watching the GoPro footage. It freezes. We're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where we meet our new captain, SHARON JACKSON. [Reader's Note: the precinct is shot in the same faux doc style aesthetic as THE OFFICE. ] Lady Captain Jackson rewinds the tape in disbelief...

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN JACKSON
dialogues.text: Did you really yell "Clooney" before attacking? Mathers and Ryan sit in chairs, hang dog.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: George Clooney is my spirit animal.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN JACKSON
dialogues.text: Well, your spirit animal is about to get the city in a serious god damn lawsuit. That Spielberg Scorsese you assaulted is threatening to sue.  13.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Captain, it was an honest mist--

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN JACKSON
dialogues.text: Nope. Detective. You don't get to talk. You're on thin enough ice as it is.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Honestly, none of this would've happened if I had a badge.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN JACKSON
dialogues.text: You want a badge? Become a real cop and stop dressing like you're in the Nutcracker.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: This is for my Hamilton audition. It's period authentic.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN JACKSON
dialogues.text: Well, I'm period authentic pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: More genre authentic, but I totally honor that feeling. And before we dialogue further on this, can I just say I think it's such a cool cosmic coincidence that the old Captain Jackson and you share the same last name. Are you guys related?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN JACKSON
dialogues.text: Why? Because we're both black?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (stunned) You're black? I honestly didn't notice. I don't see color -- just people. And auras. (to Mathers) Did you know she's black? Crazy, right? Mathers looks like she's about to die.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Captain -- I let him out of my sight for two seconds, it was a mistake and it won't happen again. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATHERS (cont'd) We've got a good lead on the case and we'll close it. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN JACKSON
dialogues.text: Yeah -- you better close it. And quickly or Vanilla Ice here won't be the only one in this room without a badge. (beat) Now get the hell out of my office. Mathers and Ryan slink out. Ryan whispers...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: FYI, I think she meant you on the badge thing. Mathers shoots him a murderous glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER STARR, formerly the blonde in the towel, sits opposite Ryan and Mathers...

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: What do you mean she's dead?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Well I guess I mean it literally.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: I don't understand, I just saw Jane yesterday. She was spending the night at John's -- they were gonna rehearse for the showcase tonight.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Showcase?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: Yeah -- it's where a bunch of actors do scenes from other plays and movies for casting directors.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I know what a showcase is. I'm an actor.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: You keep saying that. Would I have seen you on anything?  15.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: This. This show that you're literally on right now.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: This is a show? Who's it for?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: YouTube Red.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: Never heard of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No one has. That's the point. My partner and I here are gonna put them on the map. Big time. Kabloom. Emmy. Kabloom Golden Globe. Kabloom other TV award I can't think of right now. Like a SAG or something.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yeah -- whatever to you. Mathers steps in...

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Okay ladies, calm down -- can we just focus here. You said she was preparing for a performance?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: Yeah -- they were doing the death scene from Baz Lurhmann's Romeo & Juliet.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: That explains the outfits. And they flipped gender roles to keep it fresh. Clever. Makes perfect sense.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: None of this makes sense. First of all Romeo & Juliet was written by William Shakespeare.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Technically maybe, but Baz's was like way better than the original. Kinda like Ocean's Eleven. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RYAN (cont'd) Pre-Titanic Leo. Post-Catalano, pre- Homeland Danes. So good. Plus, not to make this a history lesson or anything, but that Roland Emmerich movie totally disproved that Shakespeare even ever existed. So... Mathers clenches her jaw, trying to ward off a conniption

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Never mind. (to Parker) Please, continue.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: Well, they were stressed out about it. I know because we all are. I'm in the class too. Jared and I were rehearsing our scene from Scream before Mr. Hero here "saved the day" and broke Jared's arm.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Allegedly. FYI -- I'm not really approaching my role as a "hero" per se, but more of a troubled protagonist.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: That's such an obvious choice. Look, all I'm saying is tonight's gonna be huge. Some big time agents' assistants are gonna be in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (intrigued) Really? Like who?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: (cutting in) What's the class called?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: It's Alfonso Diaphano's exotic scene study and review.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Alfonso Diaphano? That's an actual human being's name?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: He's only like one of the best acting teachers east of the 405. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RYAN (cont'd) He was Taylor Lautner's on-set coach for like all of the Twilight movies. He teaches at this old school place downtown. His class is impossible to get in to. (to Parker) You must be good.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: Better than you.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (aside to Mathers) I don't like her. I think she did it.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Relax. (to Parker) Well, it looks for all the world like your roommate, Jane, stabbed her acting partner in the chest and then swallowed some poison to off herself in the process. Quite the little scene stealer, wouldn't you say?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: That doesn't make any sense. (beat) Why would she kill John on the same day he proposed? Ryan and Mathers share a dumbfounded look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Mathers exit the INTERVIEW ROOM and walk toward through the BULLPEN as we track with them. Ryan checks hi phone...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: She wasn't lying. Look, Jane updated her Facebook page that morning. JANE DOUGH's Facebook page: a picture of a modest ENGAGEM RING on her hand with the tagline: He asked!!! #HappyWife RYAN (cont'd) I didn't see an engagement ring on her finger.  10 18.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: That's because there wasn't one. Mathers mind races. They keep walking. We keep tracking. MATHERS (cont'd) Still doesn't explain why his blood was on her hands. (beat) We're gonna need some answers.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Totally. Ryan's smirking.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: We just did our first walk and talk together.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: This whole thing was just a walk & talk one-er. It's like a way to make boring plot stuff less boring for the audience. They did it all the time on The West Wing (so good right?). See how we just went in like a big circle but nothing really happened-- WHACK -- Ryan walks balls-first into a BANISTER BEAM, doubling over and dropping. Mathers doesn't break stride.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: That just did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two DEAD BODIES lie on STAINLESS STEEL SLABS as Ryan Mathers get the lowdown from PRIYA DAS (30s) a sober Indi American Medical Examiner. She pulls down her exam mask, revealing a strikingly beautiful face.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: We got the lab results back an hour go.  19. Ryan is stunned...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Whoa -- time out -- you're crazy hot.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No, I mean that in a good way. Plus, your face is like totally diverse.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I'm just saying you could play a doctor on TV or something.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: I'm a doctor in real life.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yeah -- but you could be one on TV.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: Why would I want to do that? Ryan is utterly flummoxed by that response.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I'm gonna step in here. What did the labs tell you?

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: She drank a concentrated form of a chemical compound NaOH.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Sodium Hydroxide. (off Mathers look) I played a "cool" chemistry teacher for a three ep arc on Heart of Dixie season five. No biggie.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: He's right. Sodium Hydroxide is the active ingredient in Drano. Highly corrosive. She basically chugged acid.  20.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Ugly way to go. What about the blood on her hands?

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: We tested it and it isn't his and it's not hers either.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh shit -- is it alien blood?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Ignore him. I don't follow. You're saying there was a third party?

dialogues.speaker: MEDICAL EXAMINER
dialogues.text: No. I'm saying it's not anyone's blood. Because it's not blood at all.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: It's stage blood.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: Corn syrup and red food coloring. To prove her point, Priya runs her gloved finger along th "blood" on Jane, licking it. Ryan gags. PRIYA DAS (cont'd) Your partner's correct.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: We're not partners. He's a sanctioned civilian observer.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I'm getting a badge.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: No he's not.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: It's being discussed.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: (to Priya) I don't understand, why would she bother with stage blood if she was gonna stab him anyway? Priya picks up an EVIDENCE BAG holding the KNIFE.  Mathers just 21.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: This is a prop knife. The blade is suppose to retract on impact, but someone blocked the mechanism inside of it, locking it in place.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: So this wasn't a murder-suicide.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: This was a murder-murder sitch. stares at Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Seriously? What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What? I'm sorry I don't know the fancy term, okay? It's only the second episode. We need a technical adviser on this show.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I swear to god I'm not gonna make it. Look, Streisand, this means there's a killer out there and we've gotta find him.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (proudly correcting) Or her. It could be a her -- women can be murderers too. They're just as good at killing as men are. Equality, you know? I'm with her. Ryan shoots the camera a little "you're welcome" glance.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Whoever fixed the prop knife also clearly replaced the fake poison in her vial with the real stuff. And whoever did that, had to know that they were doing that particular scene for the showcase -- which means the killer is in that stupid acting class.  22.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Whoa -- that was awesome. You're like the first half of A Beautiful Mind.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Come on, we don't have a lot of time.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: One sec... Ryan turns to Priya... RYAN (cont'd) Hey Doc Bollywood, I've got some light smile lines coming in here and here. Can you just hit ‘em real quick before we go.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: Are you asking me for Botox?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Just a quick poke-er-roo with the ol' freeze juice and we'll be on our way. We're gonna be on the confessional couch later and that lens can be like super unforgiving.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Are you fucking serious right now?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh and she could use it too. Like a lot. Like pretty much everywhere. Hose her down. (stage whisper) She's from Cleveland.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA DAS
dialogues.text: Gross.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Right? 11 EXT. DOWNTOWN LA BLACK BOX THEATER - DAY ll Establishing. I have nothing else to say about this.  12 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mathers and Ryan talk with a scarf-wearing ALFONSO DIAPHA (60s) who flutters about the space getting things ready f the big show tonight. Actors rehearse in the background.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Mr. Diaphano, thanks for the time, is there anyone in the showcase tonight that might've had a reason to dislike Jane or John?

dialogues.speaker: ALFONSO DIAPHANO
dialogues.text: Darling -- try everyone. Jane and John were far and away the best actors in the class and tonight they would've shown it by blowing all the other performers off the stage. I bet half of them are secretly thrilled those two won't be going on tonight. The spotlight, after all, is only so big.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So true. So true.

dialogues.speaker: ALFONSO DIAPHANO
dialogues.text: Do I know you from something?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Probably. I'm Ryan Hansen.

dialogues.speaker: ALFONSO DIAPHANO
dialogues.text: (long beat) Nope. Alfonso moves on, Mathers and Ryan follow.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you're telling me an actor would kill another actor just for a chance to get noticed? Alfonso looks to Ryan confused. He explains...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: She's from Cleveland. Alfonso makes a face like he caught a whiff of something.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I know, I know -- "gross".  24. Suddenly, Alfonso gets a text message. He checks it.

dialogues.speaker: ALFONSO DIAPHANO
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I must go. Ashton has an on-set scene emergency. They want him to keep his shirt on. The fools. (beat) Good luck finding the "killer" -- so dramatic! With that, Alfonso sashays off. Ryan turns to Mathers.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Look -- there's only one way to solve this crime and catch the killer. You thinking what I'm thinking?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I can promise you I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (jazz hands) It's a...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: ...Showcase showdown! On the Modern Family-style confessional couch, Ryan and Mathers address the camera directly. RYAN (cont'd) We're going undercover at tonight's to do. We find that engagement ring, we find the killer. Right, partner?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: We're not partners.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You're right. We're not partners. We're more important than that to each other now. We're scene partners.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: This is going to be unbearable.  14 15 25.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (excited) I know, right? And I have the perfect scene for us to do together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HALF-FULL AUDIENCE watches Ryan and Mathers, both soaki wet and dressed like McAdams & Gosling from The Notebook, standing center stage. A makeshift "rain machine" offers a two-foot wide deluge directly over Ryan. Mathers gives the stiffest reading imaginable, checking h palm for cribbed lines as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Why didn't you write me? Why? It wasn't over for me. I waited for you for seven years. And now it is too late. Ryan chews the scenery...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I wrote you 365 letters. I wrote you every day for a year. Mathers misses her cue. Ryan prompts her. She reluctantly obliges...

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: You wrote me?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yes. It wasn't over. It still isn't over. Ryan goes to pull Mathers in for the big movie star kiss moment but she quickly pivots and hip-tosses Ryan to the stage in a slick Judu move. Ryan writhes. Mathers bows and gives a genuine smile, pleased with herself. A confused crowd applauds lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Mathers come off stage. Ryan is hot...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?  26.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry okay? It was a reaction. I thought you were attacking me.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Attacking you?! With my mouth?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: How was I supposed to know -- I've never seen the movie, okay?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (horrified) You've never seen The Notebook???

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I don't like movies. I find them hard to believe.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I can't even with you. Ryan moves to a WALL OF HEADSHOTS and starts pulling them down, one after the other.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Our job. These are all the head shots for the actors in the showcase tonight. On the back are their resumes. At the bottom of every acting resume is a little section called, "special skills" which no one ever reads. Except me, right now, because whoever our killer is...

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: ...-has to have a background in Chemistry.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I was gonna say probably studied Meisner. But that could work too. Mathers starts pulling off head shots too. They scan them tossing them aside as they go. Ryan shakes his head... RYAN (cont'd) Seriously -- rollerblading counts?  27.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Hello there. Guess who minored in Organic Chemistry at Baylor? Mathers turns her phone to show Ryan...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Told ya...

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR,
dialogues.text: wrapped in a robe, putting on make-up in a BACKSTAGE MIRR

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: .++.women can be killers too. Reveal Ryan and Mathers in the mirror. Parker spins.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Not a lot of six-foot blondes know how to synthesize sodium hydroxide from liquid plumber.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: And only one person in Alfonso's class does.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: You're under arrest, gigantor.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Honestly -- this all feels a little straight forward to me. I was hoping for more of a twist ending. On cue, a gun slides into frame pointed right at the back Ryan's head.

dialogues.speaker: JARED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How's this for a twist? Reveal: JARED, Parker's scene partner from the GoPro shoo

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: More of a reveal, but I'll take it. Jared, sporting a cast on his broken arm, shoves Ryan and Mathers DEEPER BACK STAGE, away from everyone, as Parker joins his side smiling smugly.  28.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: There was no way we were going to let those two steal the show tonight. I'm the one who got Jane into this class in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: So you killed your friend just for a performance?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: She wasn't my friend, she was my competition. But that's not why I killed her. Parker pulls on her necklace, revealing Jane's ENGAGEMENT RING. PARKER STARR (cont'd) I killed her because I was in love with her. And if I couldn't have her, no one could.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh shit -- lesbian stuff. This is so HBO, I love it. Plus it really connects with our LGBTQ demo.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Oh I get it. You're not "actor crazy" you're just crazy-crazy. What's your plan, sweetheart? Kill us both? Make it look like another murder-suicide?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: Why not? After the performance you two gave, anyone would believe you left the stage and immediately killed yourselves.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: How dare you. Ryan lunges forward -- Mathers steps in front of him, holding him back. Just then, a CHUBBY DUDE dressed like Uma Thurman from Kill Bill steps in...

dialogues.speaker: KILL BILL DUDE
dialogues.text: Parker, you guys are up next -- whoa.  16 29. He stops short at the sight. Parker and Jared are momentarily distracted. Mathers takes advantage -- knocki the gun from Jared's hand. Instantly, it's chaos -- Ryan grabs for Parker who slips of his grasp leaving him with a handful of terry cloth ro revealing herself to only be wearing skimpy black lace undies and heels. Distracting to say the least. Mathers pulls her gun but is flattened by the Kill Bill D who Jared shoves at her, snatching up his own gun and running toward the stage. Parker takes off in the opposite direction, grabbing the Kill Bill Dude's KATANA SWORD as she goes -- slamming through a door that's marked ROOF ACCESS. Ryan and Mathers pop up together...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You go after him, I'll handle her. Mathers rolls her eyes: typical. RYAN (cont'd) What? She's the one without a gun.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Just go! The partners split up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jared comes rushing out on stage interrupting a very emotional scene from Fast and Furious (apparently Dominic Torretto lives his life a quarter of a mile at a time). Jared leaps from the stage and hurries down the center ai just as Mathers appears from behind the curtain.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Freeze! LAPD! BANG!-BANG! Jared fires a couple of pot-shots before exiting through a SIDE DOOR. Mathers dives out of the way The actors are confused, but crowd loves it, pulling out their phones; filming and posing for "Peace Sign" selfies the action unfolds behind them.  17 18 30. Mathers shakes her heads in disgust as she sprints past these Los Angeles idiots... MATHERS (cont'd) Someone call 911! She pounds through the side door in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan pushes through the ACCESS DOOR onto the roof. Steam vents and the downtown skyline give the whole thing a lus LA Noire vibe. Ryan scans the rooftop, no sign of Parker. He pivots back and suddenly ducks, barely avoiding decapitation from the leggy blonde's home run swing -- THWACK! Steam shoots out of a freshly severed pipe as a wild-eyed Parker steps int her light...

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: You thought I was a guest star on your show?! Wrong! You're just a day player on mine! She attacks, unleashing a flurry of swings as Ryan scramb back narrowly dodging each one. It's an odd, albeit kinda sexy, sight as a six foot model five inch heels, swings a four foot sword in her underwea

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (ducking) Don't you think this is a little gratuitous? (ducking) I mean, I can't really tell if this is super misogynistic or like a female empowerment thing? Can you? Another swing sparks off of stone as Ryan jumps out of th way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jared hustles toward us just as Mathers pops into the all from the side door. He fires at her. She dives for cover.  19 31. He's got her pinned, but Mathers spots something. She fir two precise shots -- clipping a FIRE ESCAPE LADDER just above Jared's head. The heavy iron ladder comes down like guillotine, clonking Jared on the head. Out cold. Mathers rushes up to him, kicking his gun away and cuffin him to the ladder. Then she hears a GIRL SHRIEK. She look up to see Ryan standing on the ledge of the roof, his bac to her.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Shit. She takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Jordan 6's on the edge of the coping, Ryan's out of r estate. Parker smiles...

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: Any last words? (beat) Wait -- I'm sorry, featured extras aren't allowed to speak. She raises her sword when suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait -- okay?! Something in Ryan's tone give Parker pause. Gone is his glib charm, this is now something real for him... RYAN (cont'd) I get it. I know why you killed her. I know what it's like to love something that doesn't love you back. (beat) I've been a working actor for over a decade, but most people confuse me with Ryan Phillippe. And I've finally, after all these years, got my own show and it's not even on television. It's on a website that most people think they jerk off to. (beat) I know your pain, Parker. I'm the same as you. We all hurt. Moved by his words, all the fire goes out of Parker, she lowers her sword...  32.

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No, thank you. (beat) Can I just ask you one thing?

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: Sure. What?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Who's your favorite Batman? Huh? Parker doesn't follow. Then we hear the cry...

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Clooooney! Parker spins just in time to take a crisp right cross to jaw from Mathers -- CLUNK. The spindly blonde goes down i a heap of knees and elbows, one punch knock out. Ryan looks to Mathers...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Took you long enough.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I didn't want to interrupt your monologue. Mathers cuffs Parker, helping her to her wobbly feet.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Case closed. Cue the sirens. Indeed, the sound of police sirens. Parker scowls at Ryan...

dialogues.speaker: PARKER STARR
dialogues.text: You tricked me!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (big smile) It's called acting, bitch. Look it up. Mathers drags her off. Ryan watches smugly, then...

dialogues.speaker: SIRI
dialogues.text: Your Hamilton audition starts now.  20 33. Ryan curses, he can't believe he forgot. Devastating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing lights and a lovely little crane shot let us kno that we've reached the aftermath. Parker and Jared are shoved into the back of a waiting sq car as Mathers and Ryan walk toward us...

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you missed your big audition.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (glum) Thanks. Mathers tries to buck him up...

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: Look -- it's an aftermath scene. You love aftermath scenes.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess so. Just then, a 22 year-old AGENT'S ASSISTANT in a suit approaches gushing over Mathers...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT'S ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: You were incredible! "Freeze LAPD!" Amazing! So authentic! He hands her his card. AGENT'S ASSISTANT (cont'd) I work in Adam Venit's office at WME. Call me, I can get you work tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I'm not an actress. I'ma cop.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT'S ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Method! I love it! Don't change. He moves off. Mathers just shakes her head...

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I think he still had his baby teeth. You want this?  21 34. She offers his card to Ryan who shakes his head, defeated

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I just wanna go home. Ryan moves off. We hold on Mathers feeling for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMY and Ryan's THREE GIRLS sit at the kitchen table with CRYER, each with multiple devices in front of them (lapto iPhones, iPads, etc.) tapping away feverishly. Ryan's youngest complains...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGEST DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: Mommy, my finger hurts.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know, honey. Just a couple more hours -- Daddy needs as many clicks as possible for his show to stay on the internet.

dialogues.speaker: JON CRYER
dialogues.text: I love this -- it's like the cutest little sweatshop ever. The STUDIO AUDIENCE laughs.

dialogues.speaker: OLDEST DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: Mom -- how come I haven't seen a single ad for stuff I don't want and can't skip on YouTube?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That's because you're not on YouTube -- you're on YouTube Red. YouTube's Premium Subscription Service channel. (to camera) It's a bargain at only $9.99 a month.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: Like NetFlix?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well, they both cost the same.

dialogues.speaker: OLDEST DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: I wanna watch The Crown.  35.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well all do, honey. Well all do. Keep clicking.

dialogues.speaker: JON CRYER
dialogues.text: Hang on -- you guys are on YouTube Red? (realizing) Well, that explains a lot.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What site have you been on this whole time? Amy moves to look at Jon's laptop. He quickly closes it, standing up.

dialogues.speaker: JON CRYER
dialogues.text: A very different website with a very similar name. But the categories section make a lot more sense now. The audience laughs knowingly. Cryer moves to the door ju as it opens and in walks Ryan. The audience cheers his entrance.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGEST DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: Daddy! All three girls rush their father. He kneels down for a hug. It makes him smile.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: We've been clicking on your show to help you stay internet famous, even though we can't watch The Crown on it.

dialogues.speaker: OLDEST DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: Or Stranger Things.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNGEST DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: Or Narcos.

dialogues.speaker: MIDDLE DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: Or House of Cards. The effort melts Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Aw -- thanks, guys.  36.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Why hello there, white Aaron Burr. How'd the big audition go?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: It didn't. I missed it.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You missed it? Oh no -- why?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Because he was helping me solve a case. Mathers enters. The audience cheers. She's still not used to it.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: I couldn't have done it without him. Ryan nods a thank you to Mathers.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Well, there will be other auditions.

dialogues.speaker: JON CRYER
dialogues.text: Not for Hamilton there won't. Byeeee! The crowd laughs as Jon Cryer scoots off waving to them.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: That's okay. I don't need Hamilton, I've got you guys. A big family hug. The crowd "Awwws". The hug ends. Ryan turns to Mathers. RYAN (cont'd) See ya tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: See ya tomorrow. Mathers goes to the door, but stops and turns back. MATHERS (cont'd) Hey Haircut -- Ryan turns. MATHERS (cont'd) Catch.  22 37. Mathers tosses him something. He catches it. Then looks t see it's a SHINY GOLD BADGE.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: MATHERS
dialogues.text: It's a meter maid's badge, but I don't think anyone will notice. (then) See you tomorrow...scene partner. It's a warm moment. The crowd reacts appropriately. Ryan smiles. Mathers nods back. Jon Cryer pops back in...

dialogues.speaker: JON CRYER
dialogues.text: Does anyone know how to clear a browser history? Asking for a friend. The audience laughs. So does everyone on stage. FREEZE. END OF EPISODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VIDEO RECORDING stutters to life as Ryan steps back and takes his mark, addressing the lens.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Ryan Hansen, self-tape audition for the role of Aaron Burr in Hamilton: American Vengeance. Ryan turns left and right, offering profiles. He squares up, takes a breath, then lets it rip. RYAN (cont'd) Too bad, Alexander. When the bomb I've strapped your chest to goes off, your dream of an America with a strong central government goes with it. I guess I, Aaron Burr, am finally in "the room where it happens." (then) What? George Washington? How did you get in here-- NOoooOo! Suddenly, Ryan starts jerk his body all over the place as though he were getting shot to death. In slow motion. Wit sound effects.  38. This goes on for awhile. Ryan finally dies, pulling the backdrop sheet down with h Breathless, he pops back into frame. RYAN (cont'd) And scene.
